Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a skilled Python and SQL user with a strong analytical background? Are you passionate about uncovering insights within data and applying them to real-world financial challenges? Then you might just be the Data Analyst we're looking for!

Your Primary Responsibilities Will Be


Manage the end-to-end process of data-driven knowledge gathering (connect, mine, simulate, predict, illustrate, and deploy)
Create data-based solutions to address complex business challenges


What We're Looking For


Solid analytical skills (you're a natural problem solver)
Proficiency in Python and SQL (you can write advanced queries with ease)
Focus on quality (you strive for excellence in everything you do)
Strong communication skills (you can explain complex ideas in simple terms)


It Would Be Great If You Also Have


Knowledge of financial markets (options, futures, etc.)
Familiarity with financial products


If it seems like a match, don't wait! Apply now and show us what you've got ðŸ”¥

What we offer;

At LYNX, we value your growth and development; we'll provide you with a supportive work environment and opportunities for your professional development.


Competitive Salary, depending on your educational level and work experience;
Pension scheme that is fully paid by LYNX;
Free lunch from our cook or lunch ticket, fresh juices & fruit;
Travel allowance;
Continuous growth potential and a training budget of â‚¬ 2,000 per year;
Trips & activities with your colleagues;
Relaxed and informal working environment.


About Us

"LYNX helps you invest in yourself"

"Working at LYNX means joining the LYNX family"

"The development opportunities make LYNX the best place to work"

This is what the employees say about LYNX and it is exactly what we want to offer: a work environment where you can get the best out of yourself. At our office in the heart of Amsterdam, Ghent, Berlin and Prague, we work every day to offer both private and professional clients the best trading opportunities, with a fast, user-friendly and reliable trading platform.

The Best Choice For Anyone Who Takes Investing Seriously

LYNX is an international FinTech that offers you a relaxed and informal work environment, where you can get the best out of yourself and where 300 people contribute together to the success of our customers since 2006.

In 2006 LYNX entered the investor market with two spearheads: very low rates and an extensive product range. This makes the online broker not only successful in the Netherlands, but also abroad. After opening offices in Belgium, Germany and the Czech Republic, LYNX now offers its services in ten different countries, making it a European broker of size.

In 2019 the product of LYNX, and therefore the offer for investors, has been greatly improved. For example, a highly advanced mobile and tablet app is available, the LYNX Masterclass webinars can be watched weekly via the Knowledge Portal, and thanks to the Morning Call, investors are quickly daily informed about the latest news on the financial markets.

We're an equal-opportunity employer. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified and eligible candidates without attention to gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation/identity, disability or neurodiversity.

Title: Data Analyst (Freelance)
Description:
The Client

Our client is a digital hub company, founded by two of the largest companies in financial services and consultancy, with the goal of enabling innovation.

The result was a unique space where international corporates sit side-by-side and work together with cutting-edge startupsThe RoleFor one of their founding companies, they need a data analyst to be able to support on various fintech projects.

Data Analysis
Data visualisation

What they need

You are an experienced data analyst with 3+ years of experience
You have worked in banking or Fintech companies
You have experience with various data analyst tools such as PowerBI, Tableau, Google analytics

Title: Data Analyst (Product)
Description:
YOUR FUTURE, ON DEMAND

The ideal blend of stability and flexibility. A genuinely human employer that cares for people and the planet. True autonomy to shape what comes next, for us and you. This is the perfect platform to take your career where you want.

Back in 2005, we pioneered Europeâ€™s first TV streaming service. Today, weâ€™re the worldâ€™s first certified climate neutral TV streaming provider. 3 million users across three countries. Over 230 colleagues of 47 nationalities. Weâ€™re the grown-up start-up, helping to shape a better future since day one. That hasnâ€™t changed, even if the world has. Weâ€™re friendly, international, inclusive â€“ and our people say weâ€™re reliable and transparent, too. Itâ€™s why they trust us and believe in what we do.

THE ROLE

Data is a core advantage of OTT/Unicast TV over traditional broadcast. As platform operators, we know exactly what content our users watch, how popular a show is, and how many seconds of each and every ad campaign is viewed. With roughly 3 million active users every month the data we collect from them allows for efficient and precise business processes and data-based decision making.

We want to build day-to-day business decisions more on hard facts and less on gut feeling. Therefore we are searching for a passionate Data Analyst to join our motivated and growing data team. You will be shaping the big data architecture at Zattoo and building data components that change the way data is leveraged at Zattoo!

THE DATA AND ANALYTICS TEAM

We are a diverse set of people ranging from Data Engineers (DEs) to Data Analysts and Machine Learning Engineers. We love bringing more value out of our data for the organization and truly drive data based decision making in all divisions. We are a bit nerdy and understand the heart of our business operations and our stakeholders to do our job well.

Zattoo operates in both the DtC and B2B space and combined with a TV streaming product, it is a dream company for a data professional to get maximum value out of data and learn new things everyday! We are building a scalable architecture with the newest tools, technologies and methodologies to leverage our big data (we process 6TB daily!)

What Youâ€™ll Do


Collaborate with our Product Owners (POs) to understand their needs to generate insights from data
Identify and improve KPIs that are most relevant for driving product decisions and understanding what users do in our applications
Design dashboards that are tuned for decision making and insights. You will also be responsible for the design of external facing dashboards and analytics for our B2B clients
Conduct trainings for POs to understand our data and dashboards
Own and improve our product data models and documentation
Design A/B tests and interpret the results for product decisions
Collaborate closely with our Data Engineers (DEs) and other teams to ensure data quality and consistency



What Youâ€™ll Bring


Masterâ€™s degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Business or Statistics
4+ years of experience as a Data/Product Analyst in a digital or tech company, analyzing large amounts of data
Obsession to understand end users and what they do in our products with data
Data Visualization: strong proficiency in designing intuitive, impactful and insightful data visualizations that effectively communicate key product metrics and user behavior patterns is essential
Experience with visualization and product analytics tools (we use Tableau, Apache Superset and mParticle (former Indicative)) and the ability to create custom visualizations when standard charts don't suffice

Statistics: background in designing and analyzing A/B tests for product features and user experience improvements
Strong SQL skills
Data Storytelling and Communication: strong communication and collaboration skills with data stakeholders and DEs
Ability to craft compelling narratives from complex data insights
Skill in presenting analytical findings into actionable recommendations for product and business strategies, from technical teams to C-level executives

Data Literacy: as a key member of the data team, you will also serve as a data literacy champion within the organization and:
Collaborate with the data team and POs to foster a data-driven culture
Advocate for data-informed decision making at all levels of the organization
Stay informed about the latest trends and best practices in data analytics and share knowledge with the wider team

Data Quality and Governance: ensure data quality, good data governance practices, and maintaining data dictionaries
Continuous Learning: demonstrate a passion for staying updated with the latest trends, tools, and techniques in data analytics and the streaming industry


Bonus:


Familiarity with A/B testing platforms like Optimizely or Google Optimize
Python skills



WHY JOIN US?

At Zattoo, youâ€™re always on firm ground with real freedom to explore. Youâ€™ll have the support and opportunity you need to go far, while youâ€™re helping us create a sustainable and entertainment-filled future for all.

What We Offer You


Reward: strong market competitive salary
Recharge: 30 days vacation plus public holidays
Regulate: trust-based flexible working hours and the option for remote work worldwide for up to 8 weeks per year



Plus:


Weâ€™re sharing: Free access to the best streaming experience on the market
We're developing: Your own development budget, German classes and Zattoo all-company hack days
Weâ€™re inclusive: â€˜Zattooiesâ€™ are a fun, engaged, and diverse team made up of 47 nationalities
Weâ€™re healthy: Health checks, team sports, organic fruit, vegan options and more!
Weâ€™re responsible: We are carbon neutral, an active employee Green team, discounted BVG tickets and free bike rentals
Weâ€™re sociable: A calendar of events with fireside chats, lunches, in-house bar, BBQâ€™s, monthly socials, summer party and an annual off-site event



Zattoo enables our users to view indiscriminately and we reflect that in our team too. Regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, age, disability or any other characteristic protected by law we encourage everyone to apply and will give everyone equal consideration. We are an equal opportunities employer, join us and help build a diverse team dedicated to the future of TV.

Title: Data Analyst (Product)
Description:
YOUR FUTURE, ON DEMAND

The ideal blend of stability and flexibility. A genuinely human employer that cares for people and the planet. True autonomy to shape what comes next, for us and you. This is the perfect platform to take your career where you want.

Back in 2005, we pioneered Europe's first TV streaming service. Today, we're the world's first certified climate neutral TV streaming provider. 3 million users across three countries. Over 230 colleagues of 47 nationalities. We're the grown-up start-up, helping to shape a better future since day one. That hasn't changed, even if the world has. We're friendly, international, inclusive â€“ and our people say we're reliable and transparent, too. It's why they trust us and believe in what we do.

THE ROLE

Data is a core advantage of OTT/Unicast TV over traditional broadcast. As platform operators, we know exactly what content our users watch, how popular a show is, and how many seconds of each and every ad campaign is viewed. With roughly 3 million active users every month the data we collect from them allows for efficient and precise business processes and data-based decision making.

We want to build day-to-day business decisions more on hard facts and less on gut feeling. Therefore we are searching for a passionate Data Analyst to join our motivated and growing data team. You will be shaping the big data architecture at Zattoo and building data components that change the way data is leveraged at Zattoo!

THE DATA AND ANALYTICS TEAM

We are a diverse set of people ranging from Data Engineers (DEs) to Data Analysts and Machine Learning Engineers. We love bringing more value out of our data for the organization and truly drive data based decision making in all divisions. We are a bit nerdy and understand the heart of our business operations and our stakeholders to do our job well.

Zattoo operates in both the DtC and B2B space and combined with a TV streaming product, it is a dream company for a data professional to get maximum value out of data and learn new things everyday! We are building a scalable architecture with the newest tools, technologies and methodologies to leverage our big data (we process 6TB daily!)

WHAT YOU'LL DO


Collaborate with our Product Owners (POs) to understand their needs to generate insights from data
Identify and improve KPIs that are most relevant for driving product decisions and understanding what users do in our applications
Design dashboards that are tuned for decision making and insights. You will also be responsible for the design of external facing dashboards and analytics for our B2B clients
Conduct trainings for POs to understand our data and dashboards
Own and improve our product data models and documentation
Design A/B tests and interpret the results for product decisions
Collaborate closely with our Data Engineers (DEs) and other teams to ensure data quality and consistency


WHAT YOU'LL BRING


Master's degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Business or Statistics
4+ years of experience as a Data/Product Analyst in a digital or tech company, analyzing large amounts of data
Obsession to understand end users and what they do in our products with data
Data Visualization: strong proficiency in designing intuitive, impactful and insightful data visualizations that effectively communicate key product metrics and user behavior patterns is essential
Experience with visualization and product analytics tools (we use Tableau, Apache Superset and mParticle (former Indicative)) and the ability to create custom visualizations when standard charts don't suffice
Statistics: background in designing and analyzing A/B tests for product features and user experience improvements
Strong SQL skills
Data Storytelling and Communication: strong communication and collaboration skills with data stakeholders and DEs
Ability to craft compelling narratives from complex data insights
Skill in presenting analytical findings into actionable recommendations for product and business strategies, from technical teams to C-level executives
Data Literacy: as a key member of the data team, you will also serve as a data literacy champion within the organization and:
Collaborate with the data team and POs to foster a data-driven culture
Advocate for data-informed decision making at all levels of the organization
Stay informed about the latest trends and best practices in data analytics and share knowledge with the wider team
Data Quality and Governance: ensure data quality, good data governance practices, and maintaining data dictionaries
Continuous Learning: demonstrate a passion for staying updated with the latest trends, tools, and techniques in data analytics and the streaming industry

Bonus:


Familiarity with A/B testing platforms like Optimizely or Google Optimize
Python skills


WHY JOIN US?

At Zattoo, you're always on firm ground with real freedom to explore. You'll have the support and opportunity you need to go far, while you're helping us create a sustainable and entertainment-filled future for all.

WHAT WE OFFER YOU


Reward: strong market competitive salary
Recharge: 30 days vacation plus public holidays
Regulate: trust-based flexible working hours and the option for remote work worldwide for up to 8 weeks per year


Plus:


We're sharing: Free access to the best streaming experience on the market
We're developing: Your own development budget, German classes and Zattoo all-company hack days
We're inclusive: 'Zattooies' are a fun, engaged, and diverse team made up of 47 nationalities
We're healthy: Health checks, team sports, organic fruit, vegan options and more!
We're responsible: We are carbon neutral, an active employee Green team, discounted BVG tickets and free bike rentals
We're sociable: A calendar of events with fireside chats, lunches, in-house bar, BBQ's, monthly socials, summer party and an annual off-site event


Zattoo enables our users to view indiscriminately and we reflect that in our team too. Regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, age, disability or any other characteristic protected by law we encourage everyone to apply and will give everyone equal consideration. We are an equal opportunities employer, join us and help build a diverse team dedicated to the future of TV.

You can learn more about us at: https://zattoo.com

Title: Working Student Data Analyst (x/f/m)
Description:
As a Working Student Data Analyst (F/X/M), you have a unique opportunity to revolutionize the financial industry. With our platform Pulsproject we enable SMEs to get business loans without the hassle of a complicated bank check. In our highly dedicated and motivated team, you will analyze our customer data. Join our team in Berlin and start your career at a young and dynamic FinTech company.

Tasks


Data collection and cleansing: Collect, cleanse, and organize data from multiple sources to ensure data quality and completeness.
Data analysis: Analyze data using data analysis tools to identify trends, patterns, and outliers.
Data Interpretation: understandably interpret results and provide clear recommendations for action to team members and customers.
Quality Assurance: Perform data quality checks and validations to ensure data integrity.



Requirements


You are currently studying for a Bachelor's (last year) or Master's degree in the field of Computer science / Finance / Business Analytics in Berlin.
Proficiency with data analysis tools and software such as Excel.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to think critically and find creative solutions.
Fluent in written and spoken English, with German language skills rounding out the profile.
Attention to detail and commitment to high-quality work.
Ability to work as part of a team and adapt to changing priorities.



Benefits


Learn from a incredibly talented team of smart, international individuals who are always ready to learn, discover, and implement
An environment that offers room for personal and professional development
A centrally located office in Berlin City West
Being part of a fearless pioneering company that relentlessly strives for new technological breakthroughs
The opportunity to work with smart and passionate people to develop fantastic products
A pet-friendly environment
Salary progression based on length of service with the company
Challenging projects. Exceptional experiences.

HTML:
As a Working Student Data Analyst (F/X/M), you have a unique opportunity to revolutionize the financial industry. With our platform Pulsproject we enable SMEs to get business loans without the hassle of a complicated bank check. In our highly dedicated and motivated team, you will analyze our customer data. Join our team in Berlin and start your career at a young and dynamic FinTech company.

Tasks

  • Data collection and cleansing: Collect, cleanse, and organize data from multiple sources to ensure data quality and completeness.
  • Data analysis: Analyze data using data analysis tools to identify trends, patterns, and outliers.
  • Data Interpretation: understandably interpret results and provide clear recommendations for action to team members and customers.
  • Quality Assurance: Perform data quality checks and validations to ensure data integrity.


Requirements

  • You are currently studying for a Bachelor's (last year) or Master's degree in the field of Computer science / Finance / Business Analytics in Berlin.
  • Proficiency with data analysis tools and software such as Excel.
  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to think critically and find creative solutions.
  • Fluent in written and spoken English, with German language skills rounding out the profile.
  • Attention to detail and commitment to high-quality work.
  • Ability to work as part of a team and adapt to changing priorities.


Benefits

  • Learn from a incredibly talented team of smart, international individuals who are always ready to learn, discover, and implement
  • An environment that offers room for personal and professional development
  • A centrally located office in Berlin City West
  • Being part of a fearless pioneering company that relentlessly strives for new technological breakthroughs
  • The opportunity to work with smart and passionate people to develop fantastic products
  • A pet-friendly environment
  • Salary progression based on length of service with the company
  • Challenging projects. Exceptional experiences.


At Puls Technologies GmbH, we're not just offering a job; we're inviting you to be part of an exhilarating expedition that is reshaping the very fabric of the SME landscape. If you're passionate about driving growth, igniting innovation, and leaving a lasting impact, your adventure begins here!

You will work with an enthusiastic team of smart, talented people in the heart of Berlin's City West.

Get in touch with us now!

Puls Technologies GmbH

Title: Senior Data Analyst - GTM (Remote Europe)
Description:
n8n is a low-code platform for workflow automation and AI app integration, designed for technical users. It simplifies connecting to any app or API and enables the incorporation of AI into business processes. n8n is Source Code Available and has a passionate and engaged community of builders!

We were founded end of 2019 and currently:

ðŸ§‘â€ðŸ¤â€ðŸ§‘ We're a diverse team of 60 talented people

ðŸš€ Our annual recurring revenue is growing 5x year-over-year

â­ï¸ With +44k GitHub stars, we are in the top 0.0001% most popular projects on Github

ðŸŒ± We now count a total of $20m in funding: we were Sequoia's first seed investment in Germany, and most recently secured a Series A extension (February 2024)

MISSIONS

ðŸŽ¯ Your main goal will be to unlock insights that drive revenue growth and optimize sales & marketing efficiency at n8n.

To achieve this, you will:

1- Empower Marketing with actionable data insights

ðŸ” Transform complex marketing data into accessible insights by optimizing our BigQuery setup and integrating with tools like Metabase

ðŸ“Š Analyze campaign performance, demographic trends, and product telemetry to help the marketing team focus on high-impact areas

ðŸ”— Centralize and link additional data sources such as HockeyStack, Reo.dev, and Scarf to deepen our understanding of user behavior

2- Support RevOps and Sales with strategic analytics

ðŸ“ˆ Build and maintain dashboards that provide real-time visibility into sales performance and marketing ROI

ðŸ› ï¸ Run ad-hoc analyses to support sales strategies and inform RevOps decision-making

ðŸ§© Develop attribution models to map out customer journeys and identify key conversion points

3- Optimize SEO and content strategies with data science

ðŸ”— Leverage data science techniques to analyze node usage, SEO performance, and keyword strategies for maximum impact

ðŸ§  Provide actionable recommendations to enhance our online presence and content marketing efforts

ðŸš€ Explore new avenues for personalizing SEO strategies based on user interaction data

4- Proactively identify opportunities for growth

ðŸŒ± Continuously explore new data sources and methodologies to unlock further growth opportunities

ðŸ§© Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to ensure data-driven decision-making across the organization

ðŸ’¡ Be a proactive voice at the table, driving conversations on how data can further our ambitious goals

5- Drive data-driven decision making across GTM

ðŸŽ¯ Lead efforts to ensure data-driven decision-making becomes a core part of our GTM culture, empowering team members with the insights they need.

ðŸ“š Maintain and expand our GTM data documentation, ensuring consistency and accessibility for current and future team members.

ðŸ› ï¸ Set up and manage the necessary tools, systems, and processes that streamline data access and analysis for GTM teams.

Requirements

Must-have

ðŸ› ï¸ 5+ years of relevant experience: You have a proven track record in data analytics, data science, or business intelligence, particularly in a marketing context.

ðŸ’» Advanced SQL proficiency: You are skilled in complex queries, including aggregations, joins, and filters, and can make data accessible to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

ðŸŒ Expertise with Google Analytics, Tag Manager, and BigQuery: You can handle data sources, manage transformations, and deliver actionable insights from complex datasets.

ðŸ“Š Experience with revenue/sales CRM systems (especially Salesforce): You understand how to integrate CRM data with marketing analytics to drive sales and revenue growth.

ðŸŽ¯ Focus on business impact: You have a strong ability to translate data into strategic recommendations that directly contribute to revenue growth and operational efficiency.

âš™ï¸ Pragmatic problem-solving skills: You are known for your bias for action and your ability to tackle complex challenges with practical solutions.

ðŸ” Proactive and curious mindset: You continuously seek out opportunities for analysis, always asking 'why' to uncover deeper insights.

ðŸ“ˆ Experience in early-stage data teams: You've successfully set up tools, systems, and processes in a fast-paced, growing environment.

Nice-to-have

ðŸ”— SEO and content marketing experience: You've worked with SEO datasets/tools and have a solid understanding of how to integrate these insights into broader marketing strategies.

ðŸ“Š Data science/BI experience: You bring additional expertise in data science methodologies or business intelligence platforms, enhancing your ability to deliver sophisticated analyses.

n8n is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We can sponsor visas to Germany; for any other country, you need to have existing right to work.


Our company language is English


You care about diversity and inclusion? We do too! Check out our Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging initiatives at n8n.*

Benefits

ðŸ’¸ Competitive compensation

ðŸ’ª Ownership: Our core value is to "empower others", and we give you a slice of n8n in the form of equity.

ðŸ–ï¸ Work/life balance: We work hard, but make sure everyone can properly recharge their batteries with 30 days holiday, plus public holidays wherever you are.

ðŸ“ˆ Career growth: We are looking to hire 'rising stars', who can grow with the company into more senior roles. We give you â‚¬1k a year to spend on courses, books, events and coaching, to support you in developing your career.

ðŸ¤© A passionate team: We love our product, and we have regular office hackathons to see who can build the coolest thing with it!

ðŸŒ Remote-first: Our team works remote from anywhere within Europe but we have regular off-sites to help build team bonds and alignment.

ðŸ™ Transparency: We all know what everyone's working on, how's the company doing â€” the whole shebang.

ðŸ¤ Giving back: We're big fans of open source, and you'll get $100 per month to support projects you care about.

ðŸ˜ Ambitious but kind culture where people love to work - our eNPS for 2023 is 100!

Disclaimer: If you see the same job posting in different locations, it's because we're hiring remotely and are pushing it to several locations! We're currently only making one RevOps hire. Please do not apply twice for the same position.

Title: Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
Why Scout24?

Scout24 is home of ImmoScout24, Germanyâ€™s #1 for real estate. With ImmoScout24 we have been revolutionizing the real estate market in Germany and Austria for more than 25 years. Our goal is to build a digital ecosystem that brings homeowners, seekers, and agents together. Finding the right home and property is one of the most important decisions in life. So is your career! #WorkingatScout24 means being part of a diverse and inclusive team of 1,060 colleagues and 58 nationalities. We embrace difference and celebrate individuality. By encouraging open mindedness and authenticity we enable a true learning culture and prepare the ground for personal development. Mistakes are a chance to grow and to innovate. Together we act proactively, strive for improvement, and take responsibility. We talk about success and challenge while treating each other with respect because we are #oneteam.

If this sounds interesting to you, we would love to see you joining us! Even if you may not tick all the boxes of the job requirements, we are happy to hear about the value you can add to the team. Grow with us!. Welcome home!

Aside from our people and company culture we are offering awesome benefits that make Scout24 a great place to work!


Compensation: A competitive salary package and a bonus on top.
Flexibility: Decide for yourself where you work most effectively. We offer you a hybrid working model, autonomous working time management and 30 days of vacation annually.
Work from abroad: Our remote working policy includes the possibility to work from abroad for a few weeks per year (if it gets along with the business and team needs)
Relocation: Our relocation agency supports you with your visa process and an attractive relocation package.
Use our products: As an employee you can take advantage of our plus membership for tenants on ImmoScout24 to find a new place to live.
Development: Dedicated learning time per month, online courses on our ScoutAcademy, regular book challenges, structured feedback, â€œLunch & Learnâ€-Events and individual career paths to push your career to the next level. â€¯â€¯
Have kids? We'll support you with a professional family service, which helps you to find a childcare center or offers emergency childcare.â€¯â€¯
Furry feel good manager: Bring your dog to work (upon approval, as we prioritise the well-being of our employees and ensure that our dog policy is considerate of allergic individuals and prevents overcrowding on each office floor).
Mobility: We subsidize public transport or Job Bikes.
Commitment to sustainability and Diversity, Equity & Inclusion (DEI): We have clear environmental and climate protection goals and are involved in social activities and charitable organizations throughout the year. We live the diversity. Our theme weeks on diversity, mental well-being, and other social issues give us time and space to develop ourselves on DEI and sustainability.
Pension scheme: We offer a company pension scheme and support your own contribution with an attractive subsidy.
Most innovative office: Our office is barrier-free and in the heart of Berlin right at the central station. It was awarded for the most innovative office concept. We have an own gym with regular courses, napping room, rooftop terrace, organic coffee, cafeteria, 100% green electricity and a massage therapist that comes in once a week.
Health: Life Situation Coaching, regular health check ups
We are a tech company: We work with the latest technical tools and hardware.â€¯


How Your Role Will Look Like


As an analytical sparring partner to our business teams, you generate insights for the real estate online business we are operating in and support data-driven decision making plus the steering the core business
You will work together with senior leadership teams as well as collaboratively with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities to increase revenue, listing volume and perceived product value
You define measurements for product success and ensure consistent tracking and meaningful visualization of these KPIs
In addition to working with pre-existing data, you will also engage in data preparation tasks (Business logic definition via SQL)
You challenge and improve existing reporting structures continuously and enable stakeholders to work well with the provided reports and actionable insights to make informed business decisions
You ensure hypothesis-driven product development and can run AB tests in collaboration with Product Managers and Developers


What You Need To Succeed


Minimum 3 years of experience in data analytics with a proven record of accomplishment in enabling higher management decision-making
Experience in creating and communicating business insights based on data, with the ability to turn complex topics into a compelling business story
You understand complex relationships quickly, have analytical and conceptual skills and can put forward unconventional solutions or suggestions while always considering the feasibility
Fluency in manipulating, analyzing and visualizing data using SQL and BI Tools (i.e., MicroStrategy, Tableau)
Experience with Python/PySpark and statistical programming languages is a plus
Experience in user tracking and A/B testing frameworks (e.g., Google Analytics 4, Google Tag Management, Tealium, BigQuery, Optimizely, Mouseflow) is a plus
Strong interest in understanding the real estate business and the needs of the market stakeholders
Strong proficiency in English language


We aim to further enhance the diversity of our company and support the professional development of people with disabilities. We have a disability representative who will assist you throughout the application process. If you require this support, please let us know in advance.

Title: Senior People Data Analyst
Description:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 22 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

We are looking for a Senior Analyst to join our People Analytics Team. As Vinted grows with new products, locations and increasing complexity there is a need to further support decision making in the company with people data.

As a Senior Analyst your primary focus will be on analyzing and interpreting data across the employee lifecycle providing a holistic view from candidacy to alumni. You will have an opportunity to build People analytics products from scratch and shape the People Analytics function at Vinted. Weâ€™re looking for a special candidate that has a combination of HR domain expertise, strong knowledge of analysis tools and the ability to communicate well with a variety of stakeholders.

Reporting to a Senior Director in the People team, you will work within a team whose mandate is to accelerate people analytics at Vinted. You will work with data across various People systems like Workday, Greenhouse, Peakon and others.

In this position, youâ€™ll


Contribute to building People Analytics products and expansion of data-based culture
Understand business problems and enable business leaders and the People team to translate them into solutions supported by data and analysis
Managing dashboards, analysis and enabling for data spanning across the complete Employee Life Cycle (â€œFrom Hire to Retireâ€)
Contribute to cross-functional projects and initiatives in People team


About You


BSc or MSc in Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, or another related field (or equivalent working experience)
HR domain expertise
Strong analytical, strategic, and storytelling skills
Experience with data visualization tools, preferably Looker but Tableau and Power Bi are applicable too
You are a Google Sheets master
Excellent communication and relationships building skills to partner with stakeholders
Ability to prioritize and manage time effectively
Knowledge of Workday reporting would be an advantage


Nice-to-have:


Hands-on experience in statistics and advanced analysis, i.e. hypothesis testing, forecasting, predictions, sentiment analysis, etc.
Knowledge of at least one statistical programming language (R, Python, Matlab etc.)
Ability to use SQL
App scripting in Google Sheets


Work perks


The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
30 days of paid annual leave
Newest MacBook models
Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to â‚¬540 for home workplace furniture
A daily lunch allowance
Frequent team-building events
A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
Life and disability insurance provided
A subsidised Deutschlandticket
The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
A dog-friendly office


Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

Vinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. Youâ€™ll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role.

Hybrid Work

Weâ€™ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. Itâ€™s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days youâ€™ll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is â‚¬ 68,000 - â‚¬ 92,000 gross per year.

  • Knowledge of at least one statistical programming language (R, Python, Matlab etc.)
  • Ability to use SQL
  • App scripting in Google Sheets

Work perks

  • The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
  • 30 days of paid annual leave
  • Newest MacBook models
  • Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
  • Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to â‚¬540 for home workplace furniture
  • A daily lunch allowance
  • Frequent team-building events
  • A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
  • A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
  • A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
  • Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
  • Life and disability insurance provided
  • A subsidised Deutschlandticket
  • The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
  • A dog-friendly office

Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

Vinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. Youâ€™ll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role.

Hybrid Work

Weâ€™ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. Itâ€™s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days youâ€™ll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is â‚¬ 68,000 - â‚¬ 92,000 gross per year.

Title: Senior People Data & Reporting Analyst (all genders)
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are on the lookout for a Senior HR Data & Reporting Analyst (all genders) to join the People Analytics team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

About the People Analytics team:


Data Infrastructure & Architecture: We design and maintain the data warehouse (AWS or BigQuery), integrating new systems to enhance our analytic capabilities while ensuring data privacy compliance.
Reporting and Visualization: Define and standardize People KPIs across local teams, and deliver automated reporting solutions via Tableau or other BI tools for effective data visualization.
Advanced Analytics & Data Science: Discover and communicate meaningful patterns in people data, using analytics and data science models to provide actionable insights.
Purpose and Mission: Enable senior leaders to make data-driven decisions, enhance employee experience, and improve business performance through comprehensive data analysis.
Long-term Goals: Aim for global reporting of key metrics with high accuracy, simplify complex HR and business challenges, and integrate data insights into daily decision-making.
Collaborative Approach: Work closely with local People Analytics teams to align metrics and reporting standards, ensuring a unified approach to data management.
Stakeholder Engagement: Collaborate with People Analytics teams, CHROs, P&C leaders, People Partners, and Senior Leaders for strategic decision-making based on reliable data.
Value Addition: Harmonize data across global teams, creating a single source of truth for reliable and consistent leadership decisions.


About the role:


Data Warehouse Management: Design, build, and maintain the architecture and infrastructure of our data warehouse, ensuring system integration and data compliance.
KPI Standardization: Define and align People KPIs across local teams, and implement automated reporting solutions for streamlined data visualization and analysis.
Analytics and Insights: Use advanced analytics to uncover meaningful patterns in people data, and develop data science models that provide actionable insights.
Stakeholder Collaboration: Gather requirements from CHROs and other stakeholders, translate these into actionable plans, and serve as the primary contact for people data.
Global Reporting: Collaborate with local teams for global reporting of key metrics, ensuring a unified and reliable data source for strategic decisions.
Training and Adoption: Provide training and support to drive the adoption of new BI tools and reporting practices, enhancing overall data literacy and user experience.


What you need to be successful


Background working in similar People/HR data-driven role (3+ years of experience, a must)
Advanced SQL and knowledge about data pipelines
Bachelor's or Masterâ€™s degree in Computer Science or other technical fields
Proven, direct experience with Tableau and demonstrate storytelling capabilities
Data visualization artist, able to create new and engaging ways of visualizing People data


Nice to have:


Worked in cross functional teams and can manage senior stakeholders
Fundamental understanding of statistics and basic principles of data analysis


Who we are

As the worldâ€™s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europeâ€™s largest tech platforms, we enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if youâ€™re in good shape, then weâ€™re in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if youâ€™re in good shape, then weâ€™re in good shape
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, weâ€™ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
Look up and go for it. We will support you in developing yourself and your career: 1.000 â‚¬ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Online Canteen, Corporate Discounts


At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we canâ€™t wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.

Title: Supply Chain Data Analyst Internship (m/w/d) - Gigafactory Berlin-Brandenburg
Description:
What To Expect
Location: Gigafactory Grunheide

Start date: October / November 2024

Duration: 6 months

Time type: Full time

Tesla is accelerating the world's transition to sustainable energy. This is only possible through extraordinary speed, innovation and efficiency. Gigafactory Berlin forms the perfect basis for rolling out Tesla's incredible success story in Europe. The most important pillar for this are our employees. Their passion, motivation and engagement ensure that we achieve our goals. We are looking for you to continue and expand this success story together.

What You'll Do


Identifying trends and generate insights by conducting analyses of TeslaÂ´s data systems
Convey crucial findings with internal stakeholders to encourage data-driven storytelling and decision-making
Identify critical metrics and develop high-level dashboards to monitor the advancement of the company's KPIs and its top objectives
Constantly pursue methods to increase operational effectiveness
Engage in internal stakeholder meetings and present status updates on a weekly basis
Create reports and keep track of project performance using spreadsheets and data metrics
Support the Program Manager to collect data from cross functional teams



What You'll Bring


Studying towards a degree in Data Science, Supply Chain Management, Purchasing or Economics
Experience with data analytics and visualization programs like Tableau, PowerBI, etc.
Excellent analytical skills including advanced Excel (ie. macros, VBA), SQL and Python preferred
Preferable previous experience in Supply chain processes and procurement



, Tesla

Title: Senior People Data Analyst
Description:
We believe it takes great people to create a great product. Thatâ€™s why our team lives our company values, and we hire based on them, too. Since 2010, Pipedrive has been on a mission to support sales and marketing teams with easy-to-use, powerful tools that make everyday work faster and easier. Today, our cloud-based software is trusted by over 100,000 companies and used in 179 countries. We have grown from a five-person team to a truly international company of over 850+ people, representing more than 50 nationalities, with ten offices distributed across Europe and the US. In 2020, Pipedrive received a majority investment from Vista Equity Partners, a global investment firm that invests exclusively in enterprise software, data and technology-enabled businesses, making Pipedrive the fifth unicorn from Estonia.

We are looking for a senior people data analyst to join our talented analytics team. In this role, you will leverage your expertise in data analysis and data visualisation to support and influence key business initiatives. Your insights will directly contribute to optimising our operations and will help guide strategic decisions across the organisation.

Your new adventure:


Gather and analyze data from various P&C systems and sources, including HRIS, ATS, performance management tools, employee surveys, and external benchmarks
Identify current industry trends and patterns within People data to provide insights into areas such as recruitment, talent management, workforce demographics, turnover rates, performance metrics, and employee engagement and proactively identify opportunities to enhance the organizationâ€™s analytical capabilities
Develop and maintain key People metrics and dashboards to track progress and identify areas for improvement. Present findings and recommendations through clear and compelling data visualizations and presentations
Provide data-driven recommendations to senior leadership and other stakeholders to inform strategic decisions related to human resources and organizational development
Collaborate with P&C business partners and other stakeholders to understand business needs and develop solutions that optimize the employee experience and drive organizational success
Lead or participate in special projects and initiatives related to HR analytics, such as predictive modelling, workforce planning, and diversity and inclusion initiatives
Mentor and provide guidance to junior members of the HR analytics team, fostering a culture of continuous learning and development
Ensure compliance with relevant regulations and ethical standards when handling sensitive HR data, maintaining confidentiality and data security at all times.


Does this sound like you?


4+ years of experience as an analyst with a focus on HR projects
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Experience working with data visualisation tools such as Tableau or Power BI
Ability to create and present data-driven stories to different stakeholders
Good understanding of SQL and Python is a plus


Why Pipedrive:


A value-driven work environment where people come first
A lively bunch of colleagues from over 50 different countries, with offices in Tallinn, Tartu, Lisbon, Prague, London, Dublin, New York, Florida, Riga and Berlin
A team serious about getting things done while not taking ourselves too seriously
A world-class working environment full of perks like parties, snacks, and drinks like Spezi and Club-Mate, and, of course, office dogs
Flexible working hours as long as youâ€™re there for your team members
Freedom to execute your ideas with a passionate and motivated team supporting you
Lots of room for personal and career development, with internal and external training opportunities
Competitive salary and bonus system and all the benefits youâ€™d expect from a great employer (health coverage, transportation allowance, language courses, in-house coaches, employee discounts, and more)


Pipedrive is an equal-opportunity employer. We encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of age, gender, race, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or veteran status.

We're on the looking for a senior people data analyst to join our team in Berlin.

If this is something for you, send us your resume (in English) or a link to your LinkedIn profile and please add why we should pay extra attention to your application.

Title: Data Analyst VI (f/m/d)
Description:
GOhiring is the leading software company for automated job posting and recruiting analytics. With our tool, recruiters can manage the entire job posting process in one place â€“ from data-driven multiposting campaigns to in-depth analysis along the candidate journey. We help recruiters make the most out of their online job postings.




Your role

Developing analyses, visualisations, and reporting for internal and external clients
Creating and tuning dashboards, using Power BI, that visualise and analyse data from HR processes
Automating reports and data transformations with Airflow
Gathering and defining data pipeline requirements
Managing the scalability and rollout of our analytics dashboards
Grow with your role




Your profile

BSc or MSc in a data-oriented field of studies or statistics
2+ years of professional experience in a similar role
Profound experience with SQL, PowerBI, and Data Modeling
Proven track record of hands-on development of PowerBI dashboards
Experience with an orchestration tool, preferably Airflow
Experience with Data Visualization
Ideally, experience with embedded PowerBI solutions or capacity planning
You are curious about the data world and are not afraid to ask questions and like to research to find solutions to arising challenges
The quality of your work is important to you
Interest in growing and learning with a team long-term
Fluent in English




We offer

Remote Work:Â Work from where you are most productive - be it at home, while traveling or in our office in Berlin.
Flexibility:Â Look forward to processes and mindsets that are 100% geared towards time-flexible and location-independent work.
Making a big difference in a small team:Â We believe that small teams are more fun. Direct collaboration, lots of creative freedom, learning from each other - that's our understanding of productivity.
More than a job - discovering the future:Â You'll work at the heart of digitalization in recruiting and perhaps discover the job of a lifetime.
Choose your device - we pay:Â For your remote job youâ€™ll get a laptop and a technical setup of your choice.
World-class team and onboarding:Â Your team members Lucas and RÃ©my will guide you through our hands-on onboarding, so you feel in good hands from the very beginning.Â HereÂ you can meet the team.
Two Offsites a year:Â Twice a year you will spend a week with all your coworkers in different locations within Europe.
Keep growing:Â Take advantage of our training opportunities using various training platforms.




Want to work together on the future of recruiting?

Simply send us your CV or LinkedIn / Xing profile. No cover letter needed. We are happy to hear from you. Diversity and equal opportunity are very important to us. We are happy about the interest of all candidates and strive to provide feedback as quickly as possible.

Title: Fully Remote : Data Analyst
Description:
We are hiring freelance English & German speaking Online Data Analyst's for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.




This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, eg verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.







Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & German
You must be living in Germany for the last 2 consecutive years
Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information
You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Germany.
Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. Maps, News, Audio tasks, Relevance)
Willingness to learn and adapt to changing guidelines and tasks







Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.







Why Join the TELUS International AI Community?

Earn additional income with flexible hours to fit your lifestyle
Better work-life balance
Be your own boss
Complimentary well-being package, encompassing a wealth of well-being resources
Be part of an online community







Payment

Rate of pay per task is inclusive of reading task guidelines. Payment will be issued in accordance with the terms of the contributor agreement upon successful completion of tasks.







Whatâ€™s next?

If this sounds like a role youâ€™d be interested in taking on, please apply below.

https://jobs.telusinternational.com/en_US/careers/PipelineDetail/Online-Data-Quality-Analyst-m-f-d-Germany/21405







Important notice: TELUS International will never request a monetary deposit for any role or project with the company, and our recruitment and sourcing teams only use @telusinternational.com or @telusinternational.ai addresses when emailing candidates. If you are unsure as to whether a job offer is legitimate, please contact us at TI_AICommunitySupport@telusinternational.com for confirmation.

Title: Data Engineer / Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
The PACE Flight Operations Team is currently looking for a Data Engineer / Data Analyst (m/f/d). The position is a full-time position, to be held in Berlin, Germany. In that role you are part of a team, that is developing a new product in the field of civil aviation. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, data engineering, and a keen interest in the aviation or flight operations domain. You will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting complex datasets related to flight operations and -performance. Your insights will help drive strategic decisions and innovations in our application. Be part of making the aviation more efficient!

Responsibilities & Job Description


You are responsible for the data analytics of our Flight Profile Optimizer
You will maintain and re-new the necessary infrastructure
You collect, process, and analyze large datasets from various sources, including flight data, maintenance records, and operational logs.
You develop and maintain data pipelines and ETL processes to ensure data integrity and accessibility.
You perform statistical analysis and create and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to communicate findings to stakeholders and customers
You collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, product owners, and aviation experts, to understand data requirements and deliver actionable insights.
You ensure data quality and implement best practices for data governance and stay up-to-date with industry trends and advancements in data analysis and aviation technology.



Required Qualifications

Mandatory


You hold a bachelorâ€™s or masterâ€™s degree in data science, computer science, statistics, engineering, or a related field.
You have at least 3 years of experience as a data engineer or data analyst
You have proven experience as a data analyst, data engineer, or similar role, preferably in the aviation domain.
You are proficient in data analysis tools and programming languages such as SQL, Python, R, and data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI.
You have experience with big data technologies and platforms (e.g., Snowflake, AWS, Azure)
You have strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
You are excellent in communication and collaboration skills.
You are able to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously.



Desired


You understand flight operations, aircraft systems and maintenance procedures
You have a good mathematical understanding
An aerospace background is a plus
Experience with flight data monitoring (FDM) and analysis.
An AWS certificate is a plus
Familiarity with machine learning techniques and tools.



Behavioral skills


You have a solution-oriented mindset
You are a fast learner and able to work independently / with own responsibility



We offer


An interesting job in the aerospace industry with direct interaction with many leading aerospace companies
Working with very talented and passionate people in a professional environment.
International projects with the opportunity to gain deep domain knowledge and expertise.
A modern office with top-of-the-line equipment, situated in the historic Westend train station with great transport accessibility.
Employee discounts from top suppliers from different business areas
Flexibility to work from home
A comprehensive compensation package
20 days per year of mobile working from other EU countries



If you find this position interesting, please send us your cover letter, CV, certificates and references.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Job Title: Data Engineer (Hybrid - Up to â‚¬78K)

Location: Berlin, Germany (Office Visits Required Once a Month)

Company: Top Marketing Agency in Germany

Join Germanyâ€™s premier marketing agency as a Data Engineer and help drive cutting-edge data solutions for influential marketing campaigns. Based in Berlin, this top agency offers a unique opportunity to make a significant impact in a dynamic field.

Benefits:

Attractive Salary: Competitive compensation up to â‚¬78,000 annually
Hybrid Working Model: Enjoy the flexibility of remote work with only one office visit required per month
Career Advancement: Access to professional development resources, including training and certifications
Innovative Environment: Work with state-of-the-art technologies and tools in a forward-thinking company
Comprehensive Health Coverage: Full health insurance and wellness support
Work-Life Balance: Flexible working hours to accommodate your lifestyle
Collaborative Team Culture: Engage with a vibrant team and participate in regular team-building activities

Role Overview:

As a Data Engineer, you will be instrumental in developing and managing data pipelines that support the agencyâ€™s marketing strategies. Youâ€™ll collaborate closely with data scientists and marketing professionals to deliver actionable insights and ensure data integrity.

Key Responsibilities:

Design, implement, and maintain scalable data pipelines
Develop ETL processes to ensure efficient data handling
Work with cross-functional teams to provide data solutions and insights
Optimize data storage and retrieval systems for performance and reliability
Ensure compliance with data security and governance best practices
Stay current with industry advancements and technologies

Requirements:

Proven experience as a Data Engineer with expertise in data modeling and ETL processes
Proficiency in SQL and Python, with experience using data integration and visualization tools
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud, Azure)
Ability to convert complex data into meaningful insights for marketing strategies
Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail
Fluent in English (German is an advantage but not required)

Title: Business Intelligence Consultant, Jigsaw (Remote) - $100,000/year USD
Description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Jigsaw. Have you got what it takes?

The software industry is rapidly evolving, driven by the demand for more immediate, actionable insights. Traditional business intelligence tools often fall short in delivering the speed and depth of analysis that clients require in a fast-paced, data-driven environment. Businesses that canâ€™t keep up with this demand risk losing out to competitors who are more agile and technologically advanced. Our approach to this challenge is to merge cutting-edge AI with proven BI tools to create a new breed of business intelligence solutions. By integrating generative AI into platforms like Tableau and Alteryx, weâ€™re transforming them into powerful, predictive tools that can significantly enhance client satisfaction and drive business success.

This role is not for someone looking to simply run complex data models or stay behind the scenes. Itâ€™s about practical applicationâ€”using AI and BI to build data visualizations and pipelines that are as reliable as they are innovative. Unlike a data scientist role, which might focus more on theoretical models, this position demands a deep understanding of client needs and a commitment to turning those needs into tangible, high-quality solutions. This is a client-centric role where your ability to consult, advise, and deliver will set you apart.

At Jigsaw you will be joining a team at the forefront of AI-enhanced business intelligence, where your contributions will directly influence the direction of the industry. If youâ€™re passionate about pushing the boundaries of whatâ€™s possible with AI and BI, and you thrive in a dynamic, client-focused environment, this is the opportunity to make a real impact.

What You Will Be Doing


Data Visualization Creation: Producing Tableau dashboards and other data visualization outputs for clients
Data Pipeline Development: Building and enhancing data workflows using Alteryx
Client Consultation: Engaging with clients to define requirements, provide recommendations, and ensure that our solutions meet their business needs


Business Intelligence Consultant Key Responsibilities


Use AI to accelerate the delivery of business intelligence solutions and significantly improve client satisfaction


Basic Requirements


Must be based in the European Union, United Kingdom, or EEA
At least 5 years of experience using Tableau in a professional capacity
Professional experience using Alteryx
Professional experience using generative AI tools to speed up BI processes
Professional experience translating technical information into non-technical business language that customers can easily understand


About Jigsaw

Delivered on a software-as-a-service (SaaS) platform, Jigsawâ€™s virtual learning and collaboration technology enables our customers to revolutionize how they train, educate, collaborate and work through a virtual environment â€“ helping them embrace digital transformation and enhance their organizationsâ€™ success.

There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!

Working with Crossover

This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $50 USD/hour, which equates to $100,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.

What to expect next:


You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online â€œscreeningâ€ assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.


Important! If you do not receive an email from us:


First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as â€œNot Spamâ€ since you will receive other emails as well.
Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

Title: Data Engineer (f/m/d)
Description:
Your mission

VisionAI is a fast-growing AI startup based in Berlin & London and we are at the forefront of reshaping online retail through innovative AI technologies. We're on a mission to level the playing field, providing intelligent tools that empower all online retailers with data-based decision-making capabilities, not just giants like Amazon. Our expert founding team comprises former online retailers and data scientists, who are committed to bringing e-commerce into the future, today.

About Our Mission

Every online retailer deserves access to the latest AI technologies, regardless of size or customer data. Our strong data and research background allows us to pioneer new methods in visual AI, expanding the application possibilities of these technologies.

Our tools help customers grow revenue, increase customer satisfaction and reduce the cost of operating all with the click of a button.

Join the Rebellion and become a vital part of VisionAI!

Role expectations: What youâ€™ll be responsible for


Design, build, and maintain scalable data pipelines that support a wide range of data consumers, from internal teams focused on optimization to external platforms showcasing our platform's impact.
Collaborate closely with software engineers, AI researchers, and business stakeholders to gather requirements and deliver tailored, scalable data solutions.
Implement robust data warehousing solutions to ensure secure and efficient data storage and retrieval, supporting various analytical and operational needs.
Develop tools and systems to monitor, analyze, and improve data quality, ensuring that our data is reliable and accurate for all use cases.
Contribute to the expansion of our platformâ€™s data-driven features, empowering customers with in-depth insights into their teamsâ€™ productivity and other key metrics.


Your profile

Your profile: What We Are Expecting From You In This Role


Demonstrated experience in data engineering, with a solid understanding of data structures, algorithms, and system design.
Nice to have could be a degree in Computer Science, Engineering or similar - however, we mainly care about your skills & experience in that field, not your degree
Proficiency in programming languages relevant to data engineering, such as Python, Scala, or Java.
Hands-on experience with big data tools (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) and data pipeline orchestration tools (e.g. Argo Workflows).
Proficiency in designing, implementing, and managing databases, including experience with SQL and NoSQL databases (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Neo4j).
A proactive approach to ensuring data quality and reliability, with a commitment to continuous improvement and innovation.


Why us?

As part of the VisionAI team, you will be looked after with some great benefits including:


Supportive Team: Be a key player in our engineering team and help achieve the next step towards our long term product vision. Collaborate with passionate and supportive colleagues, celebrating successes together and learning from challenges.
Diversity & Inclusion at Our Core: We are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. At VisionAI, we believe that having diverse teams where everyone can bring their whole self to work is key to our success. We celebrate all backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives.
Work-Life Balance: We understand the importance of work-life balance and offer flexible working arrangements to support your personal and professional life: Whether it is flexible working hours or working from home when you need it. Oh and by the way: Longing for sunshine in the fall? Take advantage of a workation and work from a sunny location anywhere in europe.
Vibrant Office Space: Our office isnâ€™t just a place to workâ€”itâ€™s a hub of activity and connection! Enjoy our team-space, daily lunches, our office gym, regular team-events and our vibrant office culture whenever you feel like it.
Professional Development: We are committed to your growth, offering ongoing training and development opportunities. Youâ€™ll have the chance to influence processes, learn new technologies, and advance your career.
Top-Notch Equipment: Receive a new MacBook, headphones and other essential tools to excel in your role.
Feel-Good Guarantee & Culture: We prioritize openness, fun, and community. Enjoy drinks, social events, and feel free to bring your dog to the office.


About Us

VisionAI is a fast-growing AI startup based in Bielefeld, Berlin & London and we are at the forefront of reshaping online retail through innovative AI technologies. We're on a mission to level the playing field, providing intelligent tools that empower all online retailers with data-based decision-making capabilities, not just giants like Amazon. Our expert founding and management team comprises former online retailers and data scientists, who are committed to bringing e-commerce into the future, today.

  • Diversity & Inclusion at Our Core: We are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. At VisionAI, we believe that having diverse teams where everyone can bring their whole self to work is key to our success. We celebrate all backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives.
  • Work-Life Balance: We understand the importance of work-life balance and offer flexible working arrangements to support your personal and professional life: Whether it is flexible working hours or working from home when you need it. Oh and by the way: Longing for sunshine in the fall? Take advantage of a workation and work from a sunny location anywhere in europe.
  • Vibrant Office Space: Our office isnâ€™t just a place to workâ€”itâ€™s a hub of activity and connection! Enjoy our team-space, daily lunches, our office gym, regular team-events and our vibrant office culture whenever you feel like it.
  • Professional Development: We are committed to your growth, offering ongoing training and development opportunities. Youâ€™ll have the chance to influence processes, learn new technologies, and advance your career.
  • Top-Notch Equipment: Receive a new MacBook, headphones and other essential tools to excel in your role.
  • Feel-Good Guarantee & Culture: We prioritize openness, fun, and community. Enjoy drinks, social events, and feel free to bring your dog to the office.

About Us

VisionAI is a fast-growing AI startup based in Bielefeld, Berlin & London and we are at the forefront of reshaping online retail through innovative AI technologies. We're on a mission to level the playing field, providing intelligent tools that empower all online retailers with data-based decision-making capabilities, not just giants like Amazon. Our expert founding and management team comprises former online retailers and data scientists, who are committed to bringing e-commerce into the future, today.

Title: Data Engineer (f/m/d)
Description:
Overview:

Join our forward-thinking data team to create advanced data tools for GenAI applications. We use data to help our customers and support our own new products and research. As a Data Engineer, you will play a crucial role in building and optimizing data infrastructure, ensuring our solutions are robust, scalable, and ready for the challenges of tomorrow.

Your responsibilities:


Design and implement scalable processes to handle large-scale data (terabytes of text) for storage, versioning, and documentation.
Architect, develop, and maintain web services that allow for efficient consumption of harvested data.
Collaborate with researchers and software engineers to enhance data collection methodologies.
Prepare datasets for various Machine Learning use cases, including Generative AI.
Build and automate preprocessing pipelines tailored to different applications
Provide reliable data services that enable other teams to build new products on top of our data infrastructure.


Your profile:


You have 3+ years of experience working as a Data Engineer.
You are fluent in Python and at least one other programming language.
You possess a strong understanding of distributed systems and how to leverage them for efficient data pipelines.
You have a solid software engineering background with a focus on writing clean and pragmatic code.
You excel in data wrangling, including extracting, transforming, cleaning, and standardizing data from multiple sources.
You are knowledgeable about Generative AI use cases and the critical role of data in developing new solutions.


Nice if you have:


Experience working in multicloud environments (e.g., GCP, Azure, AWS) and on-premise setups.
Experience with Machine Learning and/or Data Science.
Experience in Golang is a plus


What you can expect from us:


Become part of an AI revolution
30 Days of paid vacation
Flexible working hours
Join a dynamic start-up and a rapidly growing team
Work with international industry and science experts
Take on responsibility and shape our company and technology
Regular team events
